definition[0]: to step heavily on something, so that you crush it with your feet
example[0]: The children were in danger of being trampled underfoot in the crowd.
example[1]: Several people were nearly trampled to death in the rush to get out.
example[2]: There was a small fence to stop people trampling on the flowers.
definition[1]: to behave in a way that shows that you do not care about someone’s rights or feelings
example[3]: Their interests and rights had been trampled underfoot.
example[4]: Don’t let people trample all over you.
